intro: Teramnus gracilis, commonly known as slender teramnus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals and five stamens. Teramnus gracilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
